cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest along the southeast Florida coast today, then curving north-northwest tonight and accelerating north-northeast parallel to the U.S. East Coast toward Georgia and the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible brief landfall or very close pass along Florida’s east coast near the Treasure Coast/Cape Canaveral area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-Surge Watch from Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast northward through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 40–50 mph, gusts 50–60 mph) possible this afternoon and evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the immediate coast and intracoastal waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 6 inches may cause urban and flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornado risk cannot be ruled out.
